text: What is your favorite calendar application?
Why is this your favorite calendar application?
answers: I don't like in-browser calendars because they slow down the whole system. Outlook is a dedicated app that runs on its own and is not relying on Java or Flash browser plugin.
It's the one I'm most familiar with and it's very simple to use
I am too used to it. I don't remember the time I was not using it.
It takes care of all my calendar needs like scheduling meeting, tasks reminder, vacation
Haven't used it much but found it convenient enough
It's easily arrangable and most frquently used.
It colorful and very easy to use. Plus all my personal things are google
It integrates tightly with email and Slack. I can easily see other people's calendars and book times at work.

text: What is your proficiency with Microsoft Outlook?
How often do you use Microsoft Outlook?
With Microsoft Outlook, How often do you use the shared calendar function when booking meetings?

Please read the textual prototype at the provided link below.  Directly comparing this prototype with the existing functionality of Microsoft outlook, please rate the degree to which the prototype redesign is BETTER than the existing functionality regarding design:
Regarding the ability to quickly and easily book a meeting:
Regarding shared calendar / multi-party meeting booking functionality:
Do you have any concerns with the new prototype?
answers: Can't think of any. Would really like to give it a try, especially the "all meeting participants will be able to make the suggested times provided".
It might be nice if you could specify that a specific person NEEDS to be available (ie: the CEO) if the filter is less than 100%

There doesn't seem to be a separation between "required" and "optional" attendees. My concern is what if say 80% of the people who replied "yes" are optional attendees and most of the one's who said "no" were required?
Maybe not needed for all meeting

Because I'm a novice user on how Outlook does their scheduling, but I schedule in GMail all the time, I'm concerned that I wouldn't understand the mental model of what's happening with this scheduling routine. The lack of consistency would be hard for me to learn.
I need to know who can attend or be able to indicate who is mandatory
Not enough explanation to really understand it. No wirefreame or image
I do like the idea of automation when it comes to this kind of scheduling instead of searching all around. I don't find that task particularly difficult however but would that option.
This is 100 times easier to use.
